metadata.description: Possible accommodation by turtles and snakes to the disappearance of fish as intermediaries between prawns and alligators
metadata.context: System after adaptation to fish loss, showing alternative pathways

published_metrics.note: System adapted after loss of fish, maintaining function through alternative pathways

ecological_significance.resilience_demonstration: Shows how ecosystems can reorganize after species loss
ecological_significance.pathway_redundancy: Turtles and snakes provide alternative energy transfer routes
ecological_significance.adaptation: System maintains 97% of original throughput despite fish loss
